unit.name: Führer-Begleit-Brigade HQ
unit.History: Originating from the Führer-Begleit-Regiment 'GD', the Führer-Begleit-Brigade was formed in September 1944 at the Wolfsschanze in Rastenburg. Its original mission was to protect the HQ and its surrounding area against suspected Allied air landings. In Late November, the unit was transferred to the West and further expanded for committal in the Ardennes Offensive. According to Otto Remer, the Brigade's CO, the HQ of the former Führer-Begleit-Regiment acted as the HQ for the entire Brigade. Also, an assigned Panzer-Regimental HQ arrived too late and too disorganised to be committed. As a consequence, the Brigade's HQ had a very heavy command burden, with II./Pz.Rgt. 'GD', StuG-Brig. 200, Gren.Btl. 928 zbV, II./Lehr-Art.Abt. 5 and the Führer-Flak-Rgt. under its command, next to its original two battalions. After the Ardennes Offensive the Brigade was further expanded into a division.

commander.Name: Ernst Otto Remer
commander.PersBio: After serving on both the Eastern and Western Front, Remer commanded the "Wachregiment Grossdeutschland" in Berlin in July 1944. In this capacity, he was crucial in stopping the insurgents plot of July 20. As a reward, Remer was given command of the newly created Führer Begleit Brigade, which saw its first action in East Prussia. It turned out that Remer was not particularly suited for higher command, but his high standing with the top of the Nazi hierarchy prevented his replacement. During the Battle of the Bulge Remer again commanded his brigade with little distinction.
commander.Title: CO

unit.name: Pz Bn FBB HQ
unit.History: This was the former II. /Pz.Regt. 'Grossdeutschland', which was transferred to the Führer-Begleit-Brigade to act as its I. Panzer-Abteilung. It was equipped with Pz IV / 70 (A), which was in fact a tank destroyer. Attached as its 4th Coy was the former 5. Pz.Kp. / Führer-Begleit-Regiment, which had a mixed equipment of Pz IV J and StuG III.

estab.Name: BB - FBB - Pz Bn Tac HQ

unit.name: 4 Pz Coy (Pz IV - StuG) FBB
unit.History: This wad the former 5. Pz.Kp. of the Führer-Begleit-Regiment.

unit.name: 200 StuG Bde HQ
unit.History: The independent StuG-Brigade 200 was attached to the Führer-Begleit-Brigade to act as its II. Panzer-Abteilung.

unit.name: Escort Bty 200 StuG Brig
unit.History: Some StuG-Brigades were assigned a 'Grenadier-Begleit-Batterie' (Grenadier-Escort-Battery) as organic infantry support.

estab.Name: WF - HR - Escort Bty / Stu Art Brig

unit.name: I FB Bn 'GD' (mech) HQ
unit.History: This was one of the Führer-Begleit-Regiment 'GD's original two battalions, closely tied to the Grossdeutschland Division.

estab.Name: WF - PzD - Pz Gren Bn HQ (gp)

unit.name: 3 SS Coy I FB Bn
unit.History: The 3. SS-Schützen-Kompanie 'LAH' (gp) was none other than Hitler's personal escort company, which was attached to this battalion when the Führer-Begleit-Brigade was created at Rastenburg.

unit.name: 928 Gren Bn zbV (bicycle) HQ
unit.History: The Gren. Btl. 928 z.b.V. was originally a Landesschützen-Bataillon, which meant it consisted of elder men and performed guard duties. However, during late 1944 it was attached to the FBB to act as its III. Gren. Btl. One day before the start of the Ardennes Offensive the battalion was equipped with bicycles.
